title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 132.1 - Vegetable plant quarantine order no. 1
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 132.1 - Vegetable plant quarantine order no. 1

State Regulations
(a) I, Don J. Wickham, as Commissioner of

Agriculture and Markets of the State of New York, pursuant to the provisions of
article 14 of the Agriculture and Markets Law, and for the purpose of
preventing the introduction into this State of injurious insects, pests and
plant diseases and the spread thereof, and deeming it necessary and fitting in
order to carry out the purposes of said statute, do hereby, pursuant to said
article 14, establish a quarantine prohibiting the entry into New York State of
vegetable plants originating in areas outside of this State, except under
conditions prescribed in the rules and regulations supplemental hereto
(effective April 1, 1959) and when accompanied by a certificate or permit
issued by a duly authorized official of the country, province or state in which
such shipment originated. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
132.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
